description:
Cross-shore coastal transects are vital for coastal monitoring, serving as consistent
reference lines to measure changes and analyze coastal characteristics. The Global Coastal T
ransect Repository (GCTR) builds on the Global Coastal Transect System (GCTS), which
comprises over 11 million transects uniformly spaced at 100-meter intervals along shorelines
longer than 5 kilometers, as mapped by OpenStreetMap.

The GCTR dataset includes a range of coastal features, such as intersection distances to
the OpenStreetMap coastline at bearings from 0 to 360 degrees, along with data from
ERA5 and Overture sources. Each transect extends a defined distance from the generalized
OpenStreetMap coastline, providing a standardized alongshore resolution. This repository offers
a comprehensive framework for mapping coastal features and deriving coastal statistics globally.

data.title: GCTR
data.description: Parquet dataset with coastal transects and their attributes at 100-m alongshore resolution for this region.

table:columns.name: transect_id
table:columns.description: A unique identifier for each transect, constructed from three key components: the 'coastline_id', 'segment_id', and 'interpolated_distance'. The 'coastline_id' corresponds to the FID in OpenStreetMap (OSM) and is prefixed with 'cl'. The 'segment_id' indicates the segment of the OSM coastline split by a UTM grid, prefixed with 's'. The 'interpolated_distance' represents the distance from the starting point of the coastline to the transect, interpolated along the segment, and is prefixed with 'tr'. The complete structure is 'cl[coastline_id]s[segment_id]tr[interpolated_distance]', exemplified by 'cl32946s04tr08168547'. This composition ensures each transect name is a distinct and informative representation of its geographical and spatial attributes.

table:columns.name: lon
table:columns.description: Longitude of the transect origin.

table:columns.name: lat
table:columns.description: Latitude of the transect origin.

table:columns.name: bearing
table:columns.description: North bearing of the transect from the landward side in degrees, with the north as reference.

table:columns.name: geometry
table:columns.description: Well-Known Binary (WKB) representation of the transect as a linestring geometry.

table:columns.name: osm_coastline_is_closed
table:columns.description: Indicates whether the source OpenStreetMap (OSM) coastline, from which the transects were derived, forms a closed loop. A value of 'true' suggests that the coastline represents an enclosed area, such as an island.

table:columns.name: osm_coastline_length
table:columns.description: Represents the total length of the source OpenStreetMap (OSM) coastline, that is summed across various UTM regions. It reflects the aggregate length of the original coastline from which the transects are derived.

table:columns.name: utm_epsg
table:columns.description: EPSG code representing the UTM Coordinate Reference System for the transect.

table:columns.name: bbox
table:columns.type: struct<minx: double, miny: double, maxx: double, maxy: double>
table:columns.description: Bounding box of the transect geometry, given by minimum and maximum coordinates in x (longitude) and y (latitude).

table:columns.name: quadkey
table:columns.description: QuadKey corresponding to the transect origin location at zoom 12, following the Bing Maps Tile System for spatial indexing.

table:columns.name: continent
table:columns.description: Name of the continent in which the transect is located.

table:columns.name: country
table:columns.description: ISO alpha-2 country code for the country in which the transect is located. The country data are extracted from Overture Maps (divisions).

table:columns.name: common_country_name
table:columns.description: Common country name (EN) in which the transect is located. The country data are extracted from Overture Maps (divisions).

table:columns.name: common_region_name
table:columns.description: Common region name (EN) in which the transect is located. The regions are extracted from Overture Maps (divisions).

table:columns.name: dist_b0
table:columns.description: Distance (m) from the transect origin to the nearest OpenStreetMap coastline intersection at bearing + 0 degree.

table:columns.name: dist_b30
table:columns.description: Distance (m) from the transect origin to the nearest OpenStreetMap coastline intersection at bearing + 30 degree.

table:columns.name: dist_b60
table:columns.description: Distance (m) from the transect origin to the nearest OpenStreetMap coastline intersection at bearing + 60 degree.

table:columns.name: dist_b90
table:columns.description: Distance (m) from the transect origin to the nearest OpenStreetMap coastline intersection at bearing + 90 degree.

table:columns.name: dist_b120
table:columns.description: Distance (m) from the transect origin to the nearest OpenStreetMap coastline intersection at bearing + 120 degree.

table:columns.name: dist_b150
table:columns.description: Distance (m) from the transect origin to the nearest OpenStreetMap coastline intersection at bearing + 150 degree.

table:columns.name: dist_b180
table:columns.description: Distance (m) from the transect origin to the nearest OpenStreetMap coastline intersection at bearing + 180 degree.

table:columns.name: dist_b210
table:columns.description: Distance (m) from the transect origin to the nearest OpenStreetMap coastline intersection at bearing + 210 degree.

table:columns.name: dist_b240
table:columns.description: Distance (m) from the transect origin to the nearest OpenStreetMap coastline intersection at bearing + 240 degree.

table:columns.name: dist_b270
table:columns.description: Distance (m) from the transect origin to the nearest OpenStreetMap coastline intersection at bearing + 270 degree.

table:columns.description: Distance (m) from the transect origin to the nearest OpenStreetMap coastline intersection at bearing + 300 degree.

table:columns.description: Distance (m) from the transect origin to the nearest OpenStreetMap coastline intersection at bearing + 330 degree.
